title: CRAW4LLM: Efficient Web Crawling for LLM Pretraining
author: Shi Yu (Tsinghua University), Zhiyuan Liu (Tsinghua University), Chenyan Xiong (Carnegie Mellon University), ...
relevance_why: The paper introduces a novel web crawling method that improves data selection for large language model (LLM) pretraining, which is relevant to creating sound datasets for LLMs in audio applications.
background: Web crawling aims to gather data from the internet for training large language models, ensuring high-quality content that meets pretraining needs.
contribution: This paper introduces CRAW4LLM, an efficient crawling approach that prioritizes pages based on their influence on LLM pretraining, achieving significant improvements in downstream performance with reduced crawling volume.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Traditional crawlers often prioritize web pages based on connectivity metrics like PageRank, leading to significant data wastage.
technical_comparison.novelty: CRAW4LLM improves upon this by directly scoring web pages based on their projected influence for pretraining, allowing for better-targeted data collection.

key_innovation: The method uniquely prioritizes URLs based on their estimated contribution to LLM performance rather than traditional site popularity metrics, leading to efficient and effective data gathering.
real_world_impact: This approach promises to reduce unnecessary website traffic and computational costs associated with LLM data collection, while also improving the quality of training datasets.
limitations: The authors mention that the simulation may not fully represent real-world crawling scenarios, necessitating further validation.

new_terms.pretraining influence scorer: **Pretraining influence scorer** is a derived metric that rates the potential of web pages to benefit the training of large language models based on their content quality.
new_terms.oracle run: **Oracle run** refers to the procedure of selecting the best possible dataset from a larger pool, representing a theoretical upper performance limit.

open_sourcing: The code is publicly available at https://github.com/cxcscmu/Crawl4LLM.
